emuInput.TitMainTitle: Tim Stevens posing on chair beside sign inscribed "N.A.A.C.P. Selected Buying Campaign Against Pittsburgh Brewery," in NAACP office
emuInput.CatDescriptText:
Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 3, 1973, p. 1, reads: "Tim Stevens, executive director of the Pittsburgh Branch NAACP, walked out of Union Bank negotiations.  Wanted bank president present."

Sign on wall inscribed "N.A.A.C.P. Selected Buying Campaign Against Pittsburgh Brewery (Iron City Beer-Mustang) 1. Out of a total of 670 Emplyees [Employees], 26 are BLACK.  2. NO BLACK truck drivers or helpers.  3. Out of a total of 57 salesmen only 1 is BLACK.  Call 471-1024.  Supported by National United Licence Beverage Assn.  Don't Buy - Don't Drink"
